solution_line_template: Barbara is currently {mike_current_age} years / {half_divisor} = <<{mike_current_age}/{half_divisor}={barbara_current_age}>>{barbara_current_age} years old.
Mike is going to be {mike_future_age} years old after {mike_future_age} years - {mike_current_age} years = <<{mike_future_age}-{mike_current_age}={years_passed}>>{years_passed} years.
So Barbara is going to be {barbara_current_age} years + {years_passed} years = <<{barbara_current_age}+{years_passed}={barbara_future_age}>>{barbara_future_age} years old.
